intro: Corispermum chinganicum var. chinganicum, commonly known as the Chinese sand mustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of China, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. It has a low-growing habit with branched stems and linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This species is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
